alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Municipality of Skagway; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 1:01PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...INCREASING POTENTIAL FOR SIGNIFICANT SNOW EVENT LATE THIS WEEK ACROSS PARTS OF SOUTHEAST ALASKA... With near record cold temperatures continuing through mid week under the current strong Arctic high pressure system, your National Weather Service forecasters are closely monitoring the latest computer model guidance that is pointing to the increasing potential of heavy snowfall across portions of the central and southern Alaska Panhandle late this week. The heavy snowfall is projected to start in the southern Panhandle late Thursday, then spread northward through the Icy Strait corridor Friday into Saturday. First estimates suggest, there is a strong possibility portions of the panhandle could see greater than 6 inches of snow in 12 hours with greater amounts over 24 hours Friday into Saturday. Furthermore, the southern Panhandle will see a change over to rain, at this time, estimates point towards Saturday morning. Changes to this forecast information are expected as more details become available and refined. Stay tuned for additional statements and possible Winter Storm Watches later this week across southeast Alaska.
